# dewey

> Documentation toolkit for AI-agent-ready docs

## What it does

Dewey helps you build documentation that AI agents can actually use:
- Generates AGENTS.md, llms.txt, docs.json, install.md
- Provides 22 React components for docs sites
- Includes skills (LLM prompts) for reviewing and improving docs
- Validates docs against source code to catch drift

## Installation

pnpm add @arach/dewey

## CLI Commands

dewey init      - Create docs/ folder and dewey.config.ts
dewey audit     - Check documentation completeness
dewey generate  - Create agent-ready files
dewey agent     - Score agent-readiness (0-100)

## Key Concepts

1. Agent Content Pattern
   - Each page has two versions: human (.md) and agent (.agent.md)
   - Agent versions are dense, structured, self-contained
   - "Copy for Agent" copies the .agent.md version

2. Skills System
   - Skills are LLM prompts, not code
   - They guide agents to review, improve, generate docs
   - Three built-in: docsReviewAgent, promptSlideoutGenerator, installMdGenerator

3. install.md Standard
   - Follows installmd.org specification
   - LLM-executable installation instructions
   - Can be piped: curl url/install.md | claude
